attributes.action: Reduce the rent increases and make rented accommodation more affordable
attributes.additional_details: All information available can be found on BBC News or other news providers. There is a lot of information available on Google and other search engines. https://www.google.co.uk/search?source=hp&ei=9OO5W-XzHoOKsgHB9rbABw&q=rent+rises+uk&oq=rent+rise&gs_l=psy-ab.3.1.0l5j0i20i263k1j0l4.1192.3119.0.6552.10.7.0.0.0.0.382.832.1j3j0j1.5.0....0...1c.1.64.psy-ab..5.5.826.0..35i39k1j0i131k1.0.RwpRWh3atfM
attributes.background: It has been announced in recent weeks that the privately rented accommodation costs has been rising to the highest point in decades. It is predicted that within five years rent will increase on average by 15% whilst the average wage will not increase as much which will increase homelessness.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking for the UK Parliament to introduce a cap on the maximum rent landlords can charge, if that's what you want to happen.
